description: From New Latin stasis, from Ancient Greek στάσις (stásis). See the doublet stead.

entries.meaning: (pathology) A slackening or arrest of the blood current, due not to a lessening of the heart’s beat, but to some abnormal resistance of the capillary walls.
(figurative) Inactivity; a freezing, or state of motionlessness.
examples: His company was sized for growth, not stasis.

entries.meaning: (science fiction) A technology allowing something to be artificially frozen in time, so that it does not age or change.
One of the sections of a cathisma or portion of the psalter.
